Reviews.Title: Top notch images
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey "HandyGeek"
Reviews.Content: Having owned many pro-level cameras in the past, it was difficult for me to find a solid and versatile point-and-shoot. This camera has everything I was looking for and just a bit more.Pros:I am impressed with the amount of control the H55 gives me.Panoramic imaging built in (its nice to see the results right away rather than just eyeballing it) .Image quality - wow @ 14MP, the images are gorgeous.Color accuracy is great with good lighting.The camera handles quite nicely and is very easy to navigate.The wide angle lens is fantastic at this price. As a pro I would have spent a couple hundred on the lens alone.Excellent range on zoom. I was quite happily surprised.Battery life seems much more adequate than the W330 I previously purchased and returned.Cons:The flash is far from balanced and seems too hot to be used for fill. I'm new on this camera and I'm used to pro-level equipment, so I'm sure I'm expecting too much here. That, or I just don't yet have the hang of it.Color accuracy breaks down at lower light levels. Since I didn't have a real meter with me, I couldn't tell at which precise number breakdown begins to occur. I would guess around 4 lux is about as good as it gets. Beyond around that, it gets pretty noisy. I'll experiment with some night shooting when I have it on a tripod. But I won't get my hopes up.Doesn't seem to allow you to manually close the lens. Not a dealbreaker, but it would seem a fairly simple feature to offer.

Reviews.Title: Nice Images!
Reviews.Author: Everything´s Possible "Openworld"
Reviews.Content: This camera has an excellent Optical 10X zoom, images can be seen clearly and with rich colours. Also using the 20X digital zoom photos have many details, you can apreciate like lines in a wall or symbols in a stone. 720p video looks great when played in my laptop and it does not have blur or moving lines like in other camera's brands, thanks for the mp4 format, very, very portable. Nice panoramic photos, I use them as wallpapers. Only one thing I couldn't do with this camera was shooting the moon or filming it, may be I have toread the manual with more calm. SD Cards supported, nice move!

Reviews.Title: great outdoor, not so great indoor
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "eclectic wonder"
Reviews.Content: Good: outdoor lighting, fantastic - nice color saturation, quick response, sharp images, panoramic motion interestingBad: slow, slow, slow in low light or indoor conditionsThere was a noticeable lag especially in lower lighting when the flash went off.  I have never returned a camera, and this one went back.  I was disappointed in the indoor condition performance as compared to previous W-series Sony Cybershots and Canon PowerShots especially.  I returned the H55 for a Canon S90. It's too bad because the outdoor lighting photos came out beautifully.

Reviews.Title: great picture quality and zoom functions
Reviews.Author: Mr. Umesh K. Dubey
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a replacement to my previous Sony 5.1 MP camera for which i paid the same amount that I paid for this camera.  It's amazing to see a sea change in the quality of the pictures especially under relatively lower light conditions and outdoors. The zoom is outstanding. I can agree with the previous reviewer that the picture blurs, but I have a different take.  If the object moves or if the hand shakes a little.  In my view this is OK becasue multi-burst function has been disabled by default.  But, I have taken moving pictures and it comes out fine most of the time.A word of caustion that do not purchase this camera primarily becasue it has HD recording.  The picture quality of HD recording indoor under medium to low light is noisy.  And even in outdoor, the movie function can't replace what a full blown HD camcorder can do.I recommed this camera to anyone who is looking for shooting great quality indoor/outdoor pictures.  The smaller pocket size of the camera is really a big plus compared to it's predecessor, H-20 model.I haven't utilized all it's features.  I will right more when get to know more about this camera.  One last thing that the black plastic housing looks cheap.  I wish Sony had added some metal and hardness to the body of the camera.  Overall, I give it 5 stars becasue the camera excels in its bottom line functionality which is to take excellent shots.Well, I have some bad news.  After a week of use, I noticed that the camera is washing away the colors if the person is wearing lighter colored clothings like light blue, light green, light yellow, or cream colors. It happens when taking pictures indoor. The lighers-colors in iMode settings don't come exactly the same.  They appear whashed away.  I am having a second thoughts about this camera.  Not to mention that the outdoor pictures are perfect and even the indoor pictures are great if the person is in dark colored clothes.

Reviews.Title: nice camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Skilton
Reviews.Content: This has been covered to death, so a few brief comments on my personal experience.  I bought this to use as a point-&-shoot, and did not expect to get more than I paid for, but was pleasantly surprised.1 - extremely easy to set up and use.  Charge the battery, install a media card, and turn it on.2 - Battery / memory card door is pretty cheesy.3 - takes good pictures.  pics have good color and brightness, need little to no post-processing.4 - low light pictures are -really- good (for low-light pictures), waay better than I expected.  Bravo twilight mode.5 - panorama mode works well and is priceless if you do much shooting in tight quarters, or of large groups - however, no zoom.  Wide-angle only, which maximizes cylindrical distortion.  I still love it.6 -  I do mostly stills and had little interest in movie mode.  Very much appreciated saving $100+ from the HX5V.7 - Works as advertised.  If this is what you want, buy with confidence..

Reviews.Title: So HAPPY
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Sony Cyber-shot DSC -H 55.I have owned two other cameras in the past.  My last Camera, before this one, was a 12 Megapixel.  And I thought it, at first to be ALL THAT.  This was only because my previous camera had been a four Megapixel.  I was so impressed with the increase in the resolution that is all I could see was the ability to crop photos to a better end then I had been able to.  After the newness had worn off I began to realize the Cameron was just a lemon.  So with this camera, that mistake will not happen again.  The (14 Megapixel) of this Sony camera is not that different from my (12 Megapixel) camera that I am replacing.  So I will look past the resolution difference with ease.However the (10 x) zoom lens is NEW.  Not only to me, but to all (point and shoot) cameras I have ever seen.  Now, the 10 x zoom lens that I am talking about is NOT digital zoom.  But rather, purely optical.  There is a digital zoom offered in the menus of this camera.  But I simply turned this feature off.  If I want to do any digital zoom, I'll do it in Photoshop on my own time.Other perks include; a battery and charger.  The battery is lithium.  And knowing that a lithium battery must be conditioned before its true capacity can ever be obtained.  And even before the battery had been `conditioned' it was still able to take approximately 400 shots.  And of course four or five HRS of me playing around in the menus with the features.  And I know from past experience this can be one of the biggest power drains on a camera battery.  And this is only the first cycle.  I don't foresee a need in my future to buy a spear battery.While I am on the subject of batteries, I need to mention.  The battery charger is a cute little thing.  The part of the plug that actually goes into the wall will fold into the plastic housing.  So it is not a burdensome piece of machinery to store.  And the whole thing is extremely small.  It is only 3"x2"x1".  To me that sounds ridiculously small, and if it were not right here in front of me I might not even believe.  But it is true.  It will fit in my small camera case, instead of the drawer.  I already have enough mess around my room.Also about batteries, there is a handy little gauge, on the LCD screen, that reports the amount of battery left by a four bar indicator (like a cell phone).I spoke earlier about the massive zoom lens.  But I didn't even tell how this camera can also take a macro picture up to about 8" away at full wide angle (zoom out).  The 8" I just spoke could be off a little by + or - an inch.  The manual that could tell me for sure is over there in that box, and I am over here.  And I'm a lazy person.I'm really impressed at how small this camera is.  It will fit very nicely, with lots of room to spare, in my chest pocket.  I do wear a 2X shirt, but there is so much room left over, I bet you could fit this camera in a large size pocket.  I haven't had a chance to test it; I'm just using my best estimate.  On outings, being able to tuck this camera away in my pocket will be way awesome.  And it is so light weight.And it weighs very, very little for such a nice camera.  I have a cordless optical mouse hooked up to this computer.  So by comparing weight, the mouse is the more heavy of the two.I think I have touched on the biggest topics I can think of at this sitting, but to sum this up.  This is the best camera I (personally) have ever owned.  This would include 2 other digital cameras (one SLR type & one point and shoot) and a couple `film cameras' 110 and a 35mm SLR my uncle left to me.  And after comparing it with all the other ones available at the stores, it IS the best.  I compare every time a store has a display, to see if mine is still better.  Even some of the `better' SLR types that sell for $100's, fall short.  I would be really upset to see that a little `point & shoot' can beat my $800 `SLR type' camera.  At $225 and $25 3 year extended warranty from Samsclub, I have a new gizmo and I did not break the bank.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: nica "nica"
Reviews.Content: When you cannot or do not want to take your SLR, Take the SONY DSC-H55 instead. The range of features lets you take advantage of a wide variety of situations. In a darkened room with stage lights, the photos are well-balanced in color and contrast. Also, the movement is captured without blurring. The panoramic feature is great although it takes a little practice to "get it right" and not cut off the panorama too soon. HD video results in a nice capture of movement even for as short a period as 10 seconds but it does burn a lot of battery energy. Get yourself a spare.(I didn't but I will.) Macro shots are a little difficult to capture "in the wild" but indoors, nice photos can be captured. The 10X zoom is big improvement over 3-4X zoom. When I wanted details from a distance, I got them. Wide angle shots were good within limits. Size-wise, the camera fits in the smallest of pockets. I've only had this camera a few months but I keep it with me all the time. Still learning to exercise its features, especially manual control of the lens.

Reviews.Title: Not as great as it seems
Reviews.Author: Rafael F. Sanchez
Reviews.Content: The camera has some nice features but also some problems.  First the flash is too strong.  The photos with the flash at a normal distance come out too white.  There is no setting to adjust the strength of the flash.  The metering system gives a setting of overexposure.  At 0EV the graph curve is usually slightly to the right and the photo comes out overexposed.  I find myselft having to adjust the setting to -0.3EV or more to get the correct exposure.  This is the biggest problem with this camera, maybe it's a defective problem with the one I have.The nice feature is the panoramic feature where you can easily take a panoramic photo and it comes out really great.  The wide angle and zoom features are also a plus along with the HD video.

Reviews.Title: Don't do it!
Reviews.Author: Susan Fisher "ClubFisher"
Reviews.Content: We're a Sony family. And recently we bought this newer cybershot...NOT as a replacement, but we wanted the two new features: the 14.1 MP and the 180-landscape.We're disappointed.1) On Amazon, the camera listed the lens as CARL ZEISS...IT IS NOT...I went to the Sony website, found out the real facts, wrote Amazon, they updated the listing...and lss: the lens just is not the par of Zeiss...I know, I know, Sony says they did this, to me anyway, because it is equal quality...and maybe they'll say Zeiss makes it...but it's just not as crisp as our 10.1 or 12 cybershots with the Zeiss.2) The cameras focusing is slippery...whether I use auto focus and no matter how we set it up, there is NOT consistency in same shots as far as  how the shots are focused. Further, the lens makes a lot of noise trying to focus. Also, when videoing (forgetaboutit) much too much of my videos are blurry...again, the camera cannot focus. yes, even using the image stabilization we still get blurry shots or focus that is not on target (relying on the focus feature where the grid does show up on the LCD).3) The noise mentioned in #2...There is a slight, but discernable eletronic grinding noise...Sony via phone service was concerned...'this should not occur'  so I sent it in for service...I was called, SONY IS GREAT when it comes to service, and they said, 'this is normal'...so there you have it. I have a normally 'louder than no-sound' cybershot that doesn't focus well and makes a ton of noise.4) Inconsistent...of course #1 and #2 makes for inconsistent shots, BUT that's just plain irritating and disappointing...and it's NOT what Sony's known for ----so we're primarilly keeping with our older Sonys and only use this for the landscape mode, however NOTE...5) The landscape mode, which is very, very awesome in concept is just not implemented well yet. I'd not buy until maybe next or 3rd generation. The camera allows you to set your 180 swing to go from left-to-right, up-to-down or visa versa of either of these. GREAT concept...Further, the camera's smarts tell you when you're not doing the swing smoothly enough, per se, or perhaps you moved too much off the center and it will tell you, essentially it isn't taking the shot, and you can retry. Okay, sounds good. BUT there are times when I've taken the picture and the shot is broken into slices and so the photo is a long landscape, but with blank spots between portions of the whole image. This does not happen every time, but too many times and frankly, not what the camera should be doing. So again, "DON'T DO IT...don't buy this version!"We paid full retail from an Amazon dealer ($250)...and bummer, it's been serviced once, we were told there's nothing out of the norm' with our camera...and so, we have what Sony knows they produced...a bit sub-standard...and we're knowing it was more or less a loss of money.We say at this point if you really want to buy a Cybershot: DON'T buy this one. Get one with Carl Zeiss lens, and for now, stick to the old fashion way of making a huge landscape...many shots, and cut and paste in your choice of  photo management tool! And btw, our 2nd choice is the Olmypus Stylus 550(water resistant if you have kids it's a real smart camera to own for all the shots from sprinklers and tubs to oceans, fishing, rain play etc.)

Reviews.Title: Incredible Camera
Reviews.Author: Jason Jimenez
Reviews.Content: This truly is the best camera I have ever owned. I have bought probably 10 cameras on Amazon. I am not a professional by any means but I love photography.This camera is truly amazing. The pictures are crisp, clear and the colors are brilliant. I literally bobbed the camera as I walked and took pictures at a car show. Every single picture came out perfect. I have nothing bad to say about this camera. It reigns supreme.

Reviews.Title: The best. Number one!!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Quicho
Reviews.Content: The best camera and video combination I've ever purchased!!! I did purchased the Samsung dual  touch screen but I returned it the next day due lot of noise in the picture and is not simple to operate. I also purchased the Fine pix with 10x zoom but also with a lot of noise in the picture when I downloaded it at the PC.  This is the best camera for a 10x zoom.  I could have bought the HX5V Sony model but too expensive for me. I found no flaws.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: J. Parbus
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on Aug. 30, 2010. It sounded great with many great features none of my other cameras had.About a week later, my husband and I went to Las Vegas. I hadn't really had time to read all the camera's  instructions yet but had fun trying out all the functions. The panoramic views were great, used it at the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. All outdoor daytime shots were beautiful. Then came nighttime. I was so disappointed. All the night photos were washed out, blurry, hazy, etc. I chalked it up to not knowing the proper settings to use.Since then, I have read the manual several times, adjusted settings over and over and the shots never got better. I live near a lake and love to photograph the gorgeoue sunsets. This camera misses the subtle shades of reds, pinks & blues. I really wanted to like this camera, but couldn't.  I returned the camera today.

Reviews.Title: Takes all the fun out of it
Reviews.Author: Ben Franklin
Reviews.Content: This camera meters and fills in shadows by metering those shadows. I have never seen a camera that could fill in the shadows of a subject standing next to a wall without using fill lights or multiple flash units. As a professional videographer and a highly advanced armature photographer, this technology is a little concerning because it takes all the work that went into making great pictures pretty effortless. With that said, it was a good buy for my wife that does not want to know that particulars about taking good pictures, but just wants a camera that will take good snap shots that are not blurry and have good color saturation. There are a lot of other good features in this camera as well, such as the panorama mode. It stitches the photos instantly giving you an 180 degree panorama shot.

Reviews.Title: Best  200 bucks I've spent
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Bregg "splinter"
Reviews.Content: I looked at the reviews before I bought the camera (I always do  before I buy anything).  The reviewers gave it a high rating and I whole heartedly agree.  It takes great pictures and the zoom (10x) is really fantastic.  I have used the zoom to take a picture of a truck that I couldn't read the writing on.  The built-in flash is great. The 3" screen let me read what was on the truck with ease. The panarama feature is really great. I took a picture of my yard from one side to the other by just standing in one spot in front of my house and turning.  The movie setting is also great.  I used it film my yard and gave audible discription of what I was looking at.  And I could zoom in while shooting the movie. Other reviewers mentioned noise when using the zoom when shooting movies but my camera didn't make any noise that I noticied.  Hope it stays that way.  You have to buy a memory stick separetly.  I bought an 8gb stick (by Lexar) and it works fine.  You can take movies that are just under 2 hrs. to over 5 hrs. depending on the picture size (you set the pic. size from the menu).  Remember that like everything else today, the manual you get with it is small and you need to download the disk that comes with the camera to get the full manual you can then read on the computer. The computer maual is really excellent. Everyone I showed the pics to (on the LCD screen) were extremly impressed.  Best money I've spent in long time!!  It only weighs 7.1 oz. w/ battery.  I do recommend buying an extra battery and case (it doesn't come with a case).

Reviews.Title: Photo Lag
Reviews.Author: david in CA
Reviews.Content: it has some good features pretty easy to use, good size and a good feel but...any time you use the flash, the time between the button press and the picture being taken needs to be measured in eons (definately not miliseconds)I have a lot of sony products including a previous cybershot (bought in 2004 that had less delay, though some) and i had hoped that 6 years on this would have been improved instead of getting worse.Forget a picture of your kid blowing out the candles on their cake, they will already be cutting it by the time this captures an image and the chance of catching a great but fleeting smile .. you as well put a blind man with leg shackles and hands tied behind his back in the yankees stadium.Very disapointing product from a company that usually creates great ones.

Reviews.Title: Good photos but MP4 video, the pits
Reviews.Author: Lawrence W. Stephens
Reviews.Content: This is a combined Sony DSC-H55 and Panasonic DMC-ZS5 review. My wife first bought the Sony and was happy until she shot some video. We next tried the Panasonic. They both are very close in the photo results. In normal light and 1 to 3X focal length, they are for the most part equal with Sony having the edge. At max telephoto the sharper lens of the Panasonic makes itself known. In poor light the Sony is very soft and the Panasonic is sharper but noisier. If you don't use either camera for video they are quite close. Now video is another matter. Here it is straight from the properties from a clip from each camera. The Sony records at 1280x720 data rate 9,148 29 frames/second. The Panasonic records at 1280x720 data rate 31,168 30 frames/second. Sony uses MP4 and Panasonic uses MOV. Sony's video is good only for video sharing, moving video to MP4 devices and the like, a lot of pixilation. Shown on a large 16x9 LCD display it is worse than a good SD video. We did not look at the Canon because they lock out the zoom when shooting video. The Panasonic focus while zooming is quite good. There is some zoom noise but it is low. I would recommend a bridge camera if you can get by with the larger size and greater cost as the P/S large telephoto lens/sensor are just too much of a compromise.  In summary, Sony photo 3.6 stars and Panasonic 3.5 stars. Sony video 1 star and Panasonic video 4 stars. Best P/S I've seen is the Canon SD780 IS 3X telephoto. Because we had this camera to compare to, the Sony and Panasonic got low marks in sharpness and noise.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, great zoom, and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Tradecraft "Commit to Win"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP Digital Camera to replace an older Sony Cyber-shot that was 7.2 MP. What a great difference this camera is in settings, ease of use and it takes great photos.I did a lot of research, read tons of reviews and went to the store to look at many different point and shoot cameras to replace my old Sony camera. The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 was my choice and I am very happy with my decision.The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 is very easy to use. The iAuto setting automatically optimizes camera settings and works great. If you don't want to mess around with learning all of the options the iAuto setting will work fine for your needs. I have taken pictures in almost complete darkness that came out perfect without too much brightness from the flash to cause a "white out" effect.I love the 10x Wide Angle Optical Zoom which really allows me the ability to get a close up photo from a distance. My prior Sony Cyber-shot only had a 4x zoom and the 10x zoom is so much better. This was a huge factor for me when I bought this camera and I have not been disappointed.The Sweep Panorama Mode takes awesome photos but can take some practice to use correctly. The 14.1-megapixel allows you to take excellent and clear shots that can be blown up to a large size photo of 16"x20" with great clarity and quality.The HD video quality has been great. One feature that I really like is that you can zoom while taking video. Some of the older Cyber-shots do not have this ability. But, if you zoom while taking video you will hear the noise from the lens moving in your video. Not a huge deal but it is a factor when shooting video.There is a card slot for optional Memory Stick Duo media and SD media. I currently use a 4GB Sandisk Secure Digital SD HC Memory Card which holds about 1,207 pictures when the camera is set for the highest resolution. If you lower the resolution it can hold thousands of more photos.Battery life has been awesome and I have not had any issues with the battery dying too soon. I did purchase a spare battery as a backup. I would hate to lose the opportunity for great photos due to a dead battery.The one compliant that I have with this camera is that the battery door seems fragile and very easy to break so use extra caution when putting in the battery. Again, not a deal breaker but extra caution is needed. Also, there is a slight pause when you take photos but this seems to be a common factor with most of the point and shoot cameras.I definitely recommend the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP Digital Camera for its ease of use and great picture quality. This camera will let you shoot like you are a pro. I am very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera to take Pics on Day Light.
Reviews.Author: R. F. Galea
Reviews.Content: The Resolution of the images is great, and the video is also excellent. But when you use the camera with the Flash at Night, it can be a little obnoxious, You have to wait at least 2 or 3 seconds for the flash to operate and for the camera to stabilize the image, and even you can get a blurry or moved image. But Still a good camera. =)

Reviews.Title: The little camera that CAN DO IT!
Reviews.Author: C. Robert Edewaard "DYI Bob"
Reviews.Content: This camera never ceases to amaze me.  I have owned it about 2 months and I have taken over 1200 pictures under all circumstances.  I carry it with me everywhere. I am a serious amateur photographer who owns 3 digital cameras, and has owned many more.  I take hundreds of pictures a month, and my specialty is journal photography of events and nature shots(lots of indoor, outdoor and macro shots). The image stabilization is incredible (supposedly double stabilization).  I got great shots  from a moving boat of moving skier.  The wide angle (35mm equivalent f 25mm, yes 25mm) is so convenient for indoors and scenic shots.  The flash looks so tiny yet can fill a room even a wide angle.  It can do automatic scene selection almost perfectly, face recognition too.  It goes to macro mode with no setting change.  The 10X optical zoom is smooth and accurate, and with IS I have gotten incredible hand held pictures.  If you take a lots of pictures, get a spare battery (under $10 on line). You will love this camera.  I hope this one lasts A LONG TIME.  Bob in Florida

Reviews.Title: Great for landscapes and outdoors, Very bad for indoors! (Read)
Reviews.Author: hammodi
Reviews.Content: this camera does it all in outdoors, the quality is great! and the image stabilization works just finePros:1- Good quality outdoors.2- 10x Zoom is outdone.3- I've never seen a better panorama mode.4- Video Quality is great at day time.Cons:1- Very bad at night time2- Little bit cheaply made3- Battery life is way too short.Scores.Performance:  B+Durability:  CQuality:  AVideo Quality: B+Zoom Quality:  BBattery Life:  FHope this helped!( i got this Camera at BesyBuy for $89.99 a year ago, it was an open item but it was newly advertised. so it was like-newThe Point is this camera is overpriced and if you want to buy a camera you should pay a little more for a Cannon camera or a Nikon CoolPix!

Reviews.Title: poor images, flash overexposes constantly
Reviews.Author: Knightmessenger
Reviews.Content: I really wanted a camera that had more advanced features and better quality than a point and shoot but was still around the same size and not too expensive. Well this does have a lot of features but no matter how many endless combinations I tried, they just did not produce a good image in low light or using a flash. Everything was either too bright or too blurry, wrong color tint or over saturated.Basically it just does not look natural. Outdoor photos look decent but nothing special. Even the cheapest point and shoot would look respectable. This does not.I'm very particular about the quality of an image but even a casual observer can tell many of the pictures I've taken are not even close to halfway acceptable. The other problem is the wide angle lens makes everything look so stretched out and distorted. While that is useful in some cases, it shouldn't be set that way on default so that you have to zoom in a little just to get a normal image.I saw another similar sized Panasonic camera at a friends house and tested it out. Even in almost total darkness, the images with the flash looked bright to see everything but still soft enough that it still looked like night.Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)I would get that or the Panasonic ZS8 (later model) instead.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.... and then not so great!
Reviews.Author: crazytwins "crazytwins"
Reviews.Content: Originally thought I finally found the camera for me. Easy to use, liked the features and zoom it offered.Initial pictures taken, the quality was excellent. Really liked the quality of low light shots. But then upon taking outdoor shots... wasn't so happy. Colors just weren't coming out right, and tried many different settings. Many of the shots I took had a fake painted look to the colors. I just really hate when the color is off. If it weren't for that, would have loved to have kept this camera!  The images were coming out SO clear and crisp and I was highly impressed.Only other thing I didn't care for was it was pretty slow between shots.I thought the colors came out much better with the $80 less Sony DSC-W350... though that is only 4x zoom but pretty much the rest of the features were similar. Would really recommend that as a less expensive option.

Reviews.Title: Sony does it again! :-)
Reviews.Author: Sheepfreak "WoolTales"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my Sony camera.  It's the second Sony I own.  I also own two others so I have a comparison.  The Sony H-55 (like my W70) turns on quickly so I can catch that quick shot.  The battery life is phenomenal.  The battery on vacation and taking multiple shots every day will last me about a month.  With normal around-the-house usage...about three months.  It takes a great picture and I really like the picture software that comes with the camera.  It has organized all the pictures on my computer (9 years worth).  The camera is simple to use for the novice yet has manual over-rides when one wants to take a more "creative" shot. I HIGHLY recommend this Sony camera.

Reviews.Title: good and bad
Reviews.Author: W. W. Wager
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera recently and used it for a weekend.  Good:  Zoom, sharp lens, good stablization, good colors in bright light, movies in good light, auto macro.  Bad: movies in low light, movie audio noise from focus (I think), sweep panorama disappointing quality (would be an awesome feature if better). All in all, worth what you pay for it, but not the "ideal" camera.  I debate whether I will keep it --

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: David Mac "Dave Mac"
Reviews.Content: Thou its a good speedy point and shoot its not the fastest but it does have great picture quality in daytime lighting situations. The night time shots could be better.

Reviews.Title: Their (Sony's) advertising met my expectations
Reviews.Author: Al Sterling
Reviews.Content: I'll apologize for not being more specific, but I'm short on time. This is the second "clamshell" model camera by Sony that I've purchased. The other model, almost 3 years ago, also performed quite well. I'm a Vietnam Era Combat Photographer type, and after coming "home to the World" back in 1969, starting shooting commercially, part time, while back in college. Going from analog-optical to full digital imaging, I appreciate "optical zooms" and decent lenses. Remember that the "weakest link in the chain" for photography is always THE LENS! With or without 14 megapixel resolution, this camera is a very good value. I bought this one for my older brother, a Korean War Vet, who also spent his early years in photography. Both he and I were very impressed with the performance of this "under $200 digital camera." And yes... there are other similar cameras out there, but I find myself caught in a "Sony Cycle" right now; having had good luck with their line of low cost cameras. BTW, as a hobbyist photo-nut, I'm shooting with a Pentax K10, primarily because it allows me to use my older circa-1970 Pentax M-Series manual lenses.

Reviews.Title: DSCH55
Reviews.Author: Phillip Hankland
Reviews.Content: This camera for it's size takes excellent pictures, the zoom is terrific, and the best part is the in camera trimming feature.Good battery life and easy to use menus, another great Sony Product.I have had many Sony digital cameras and all have been excellent.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. Elaine O. Chaika "book, movie, tech lover"
Reviews.Content: I don't know how real photographers would rate this, but for a total picture taking klutz like me it is perfect.  I used to ruin pictures with my unsteady hand and general ineptness.  It's almost impossible for me to get a bad picture with this, however.  The anti-shake really works.  The wide angle is the widest I've seen so far in a point and shoot.  One thing I really love is the panorama feature.  No stitching individual shots.  Just slowly pan.  Wonderful!I bought a cybershot about 18 months ago and, although it was good, it didn't have a wide enough angle to take pictures of laarge buildings while we were visiting London.  And there was no panorama.  We're traveling again, and I didn't take my camera with me, thinking I'd use my iPhone camera alone.  That did not work out, so I Amazoned this camera and have been delighted with it.My only criticism, and it's true of all digital cameras and cellphone cameras: with no separate viewfinder, you can't see what you are taking a picture of in bright light. Getting rid of viewfinders was a bad move.

Reviews.Title: Great item, highly recommend
Reviews.Author: Rob R.
Reviews.Content: This is my second Sony digital camera.  The first was a Cyber-shot 7.2MP camera and that was smaller in size, but also is a great camera.  Eventually the Cyber-shot 7.2 broke down and the lens does not properly open when you turn it on. However, it may have got sand in it and it may be that I just need to clean it.This new 10x optical and 14.1MP camera is top of the line. Most every picture came out well, during the first shot, and I was easily able to use the panoramic feature without reading the manual.  It is a bit larger than the 7.2MP camera, and a bit larger than my Nikon Coolpix S570.The battery life went from 50% down to ZERO without notice and that would have negatively impacted me if I had not been traveling with a spare one.  But it did take longer than expected to get down to 50%.  I was happy that the same battery used for their 7.2MP camera also worked in the 14.1MP version.The flash worked well, but often it is not even needed.I did not use most of the features of the camera because the automatic functions met most of my needs.If my camera were stolen or lost, I would definitely buy this same model again, and I would strongly recommend the same camera to my friends, family, and coworkers.  I could not be more happy, especially when compared with my Nikon which I very much dislike, along with the Nikon technical support that took forever to help me resolve why some wedding photos I took did not come out!  (which they barely helped me with, and that does nothing for the photos I missed at a relative's wedding!)I would strongly recommend this SONY camera. I also gladly look forward to buying their next model in a few years from now.R

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: mjtytrin
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures in bright light.  Almost no delay, crisp colors, great pics.  My only complaints - when you zoom in more than about 5x (the camera goes to 10x), the pictures get a little blurry.  Same thing happens in low light.  There is a pretty significant delay and the pictures often come out a little fuzzy.  Otherwise, I've been really happy with it so far.  It seems pretty comparable to the Canon Powershot A1100 that I switched from.

Reviews.Title: techqie camera-interesting to try new features
Reviews.Author: hibiscus1
Reviews.Content: I couldn't wait to get this camera when orders were taken before sold. After 6 months of playing around with it, I'm a glad to have tried some of its latest technology in a compact point&shot.; Comparing this to a Canon 700IS I bought, I originally missed the optical window in Canons' old camera. Secondly, loading the Sony's software PMB on Windows XP is slow and I don't like the analyzer program running while you're loading pictures onto the computer-its just to pain stalking-slow as compared to Canon's old software. I don't know why you just can't load pictures onto the computer and that's it. A full description manual would have been nice to be included with the camera kit. Fine tuning the audio when using the movie mode in zoom would be recommended. I got a lot of distortion audio when using zoom in HD mode. However, in a compact camera with automatic settings like Easy and Intelligent modes, shooting is a breeze. I do like, how you can take 2 same pictures at different exposure settings, smile & face sensitivity recognition, and the slideshow with music while watching on your camera. As, technology changes rapidly every year this camera is interesting to use if you don't mind spending for its amusing gadgets.

Reviews.Title: Excellent so far
Reviews.Author: Stpgirlie
Reviews.Content: Have had the camera for a few days, and so far, works wonderfully.  Despite what others say, the image is captured quite quickly for most shots.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: mohammad awais
Reviews.Content: because of it,s quality of picture i love itwas a great experience u must buy it and enjoy it

Reviews.Title: Good little camera that does most things well
Reviews.Author: BillJitsu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mostly because I wanted get as much 'bang for the buck' in an easily-portable camera as I could without spending too much.  The key phrase here is "easily-portable".  I realized going in I was going to be making a few compromises as a result of buying something so small, but I didn't end up making as many as I thought.So far, the things I've liked most about this camera are:1) Easily portable (fits in a jacket/jeans pocket)2) 10x optical zoom is nice and maybe its strongest feature.3) Decent array of settings to appeal to those who want to take more than just 'snapshots'.The only drawbacks, really are the following:1) The battery/memory card door is pretty flimsy and comes open a bit too easily.  Not a huge deal but a minor annoyance.2) The controls are all fairly tiny and a bit flimsy.3) The flash is nothing to write home about and tends to wash things out a bit.4) There's a noticeable delay when in manual focus mode between depressing the shutter and the image being captured.Others have complained about the exposure in low-light settings.  While I agree the camera takes a little bit of work indoors as opposed to outside on a clear day, I was able to get pretty good images after playing around a bit in manual focus mode and resetting the white balance.  However, if you just want a point-and-shoot and don't ever plan to move the camera out of the "easy" modes, this could be a concern for you.To be sure, you can definitely find bigger cameras out there that take great pictures and have a lot of bells and whistles.  But if you want something portable with a nice zoom that takes good pictures and gives you some control over them, this is a pretty good option.

Reviews.Title: like the features
Reviews.Author: Raymond J. Rizzuto "rjrizzuto"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son to take on a trip to Germany.  He made good use of it.  I like the features, especially panorama mode

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Sara Berry
Reviews.Content: great camera. great zoom. easy to use. clear pic. i would recommend this camera for anyone. Sony cameras never disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-H55
Reviews.Author: SAD
Reviews.Content: A repeat customer . . .  I dropped this camera out of a locker (5 feet up) on a concrete floor when I was in Costa Rica and it quit working.  I liked it so much I went and bought another one just like it.  Can't ask for a better recommendation than that.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Western Bank Wolf Pt
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and is easy to use.  You must remove the battery to charge it, that is the only drawback I have noticed.

Reviews.Title: good camera!!
Reviews.Author: farmers and traders bank
Reviews.Content: my wife loves this camera.the pictures that I have taken with this camera have turned out really well.this camera also has great zoom capibilty.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Littlefield
Reviews.Content: I've purchased three of these.  It's a great combination of 14 MP, 10X lens and size!  The only thing I'd have changed is the flimsy door for the battery and memory card.

Reviews.Title: Freakin' Badass
Reviews.Author: V. Goode "Beauty Expert"
Reviews.Content: I brag to my friends how super awesome my camera is. When I got it, my friend was driving me around San Francisco and there was a dude running as we were driving and I snapped a quick pic, and it was perfectly clear! Despite me in a moving vehicle and the dude running!The Video Quality on the High Definition VIdeo Camera is superb. I used my little handheld Sony to shoot some video for a marketing piece for my company, and people can't believe how professional looking the video was and that it came from tiny camera! Although, warning.... the sound quality on this is terrible and the sound cuts out when you are zooming and filming. But for my project, we used music and a voice narration on the final cut, so all I needed was the beautiful video quality.I mostly use my camera for (concerts and local band) shows and for photos at night and it does great! Most my shots are from a distance at a show and I've gotten amazing facial close ups of lead singers and this camera shot some killer shots of Vince Niel and Gene Simmons that honestly should get printed and framed.Alot of my friends ask what I recommend for an easy point and shoot that will fit in their purse and I ALWAYS recommend Sony Cybershots! I've had 3 of them over the past 10 years. And my first one was when digital cameras first came out, and it was better then most the cameras in my digital photography class that kids trust funds paid triple for.

Reviews.Title: Cyber-shot
Reviews.Author: countrygirl2012
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera for someone who is wanting a quality picture without so much bulk to their camera! I love it and I love taking it on trips with me to capture some great moments. There is a lot of settings that you can adjust to get the perfect lighting shot. I wouldn't recommend this camera to someone who is not very technology smart. It is a more complicated camera so you can not just snap a photo and get the perfect picture; you have to adjust the exposure.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Kalvin
Reviews.Content: i currently have this product for 3 years and orderring a second one for my uncle who is looking for one like mines

Reviews.Title: Buena camara
Reviews.Author: Wilfredo D. Maestracci
Reviews.Content: Muy buena camara.. me gusta mucho la calidad de sus fotos, sobre todo las de noche son muy buenas, lo unico malo que puedo decir de ella es que trae un cargador de bateria y hay que sacarle la bateria para cargarla.. en vez de conectar la camara y cargar la bateria automaticamente..

Reviews.Title: Some good some bad
Reviews.Author: Real person "Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I have owned and used this camera for a few years now and have found some really good things, and really bad things about it.  Most pictures taken without zoom are excellent, especially ones of people and stationary objects.  The camera is slow to focus, so motion is not a strength and neither is its zoom which makes focusing especially difficult.The camera is light and compact to carry, and has a lot of settings to adjust to a wide range of types of pictures.  The down side is that the adjustment knob is way too easy to turn, and almost always is in the Scan mode when you try to grab it out and shoot.  I also had a lot of issues on how close the shoot and on/off buttons are.  I've lost a lot of shots waiting for the camera to come back on.The battery and charger are great.  Easy and quick to charge, and good for a lot of shots.  I would however suggest a second battery as backup.Download and the application to receive are terrible.  If you don't have the specific cable when you are away; you don't download.  The application tells you, and not you telling it what and where you download the photo's...it is not very useful for anything but moving pictures.Overall the camera was OK.  Mine was a good overall camera, but at the end of one beech outing, the lense got sand in it, and has rendered the camera useless.  Would I buy it again?  No.

Reviews.Title: Worth for money
Reviews.Author: Vikram Balasubramaniyam
Reviews.Content: No special reasons..bought this for my younger who is in early teens and going to start photography. Good one to start with.

Reviews.Title: Exelente
Reviews.Author: Jeffry
Reviews.Content: El producto esta genial no tengo ninguna queja ningunaLa presentacion es lo mismo que espere y trabaja genial, las fotos quedan muy buenas.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle...
Reviews.Author: T&L; "T&L;"
Reviews.Content: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle...was a gift to another person.  there are so many options for getting a sony cyber shot that to the non-technical and not tech literate it is difficult to decide on and buy.  as it was so difficult we did not follow up and get the sony digital video camera as that is really too complicated for us as we are first time buyers;  options are not explained well.  So we are not buying any more sony photography gifts.

Reviews.Title: Great camera !! True colors
Reviews.Author: Hari Katakota "Harry"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera. Best camera ever I bought..Very good outdoor pictures. True colors. Just set it to auto mode and start enjoying pics..

Reviews.Title: Exelente camara
Reviews.Author: Dhanna
Reviews.Content: Ya tengo un año con la camara y a sido exelente, toma muy buenas fotos y es una camara bastante completa. La recomiendo las fotos se ven casi profesionales.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at low low cost.
Reviews.Author: Gopalakrishna M. Elluru
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with a lot of new features at a low low cost.  It is said to be used, but looks like factory rejects because of minor scratches on the LCD viewing screen.  Everything looks like new except for a minor scratch on the LCD viewing screen.

Reviews.Title: La mejor camara
Reviews.Author: Liu
Reviews.Content: De las que he tenido en esta Marca, esta me ha resultado muy buena, es pequeña, discreta, sus funciones son muy prácticas, fácil de utilizar y la batería genial.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Moses
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera and still loving it.. it takes awesome photos and the zoom is very nice...I personally like it very much and got one for my dad as well

Reviews.Title: super picture quality
Reviews.Author: Saurabh
Reviews.Content: Very good camera. I love to have it. Outstanding light capturing mechanism. Very handy and even a small kid can capture very good pics.

Reviews.Title: Step down from the H20 model
Reviews.Author: M. Stone
Reviews.Content: I'm going to stick with my older model of Sony DSC-H20. The photo quality is better.  After using the H55 model, I can see that like most Sony cameras, it does fine taking photos in daylight and bright light or outdoor settings.However, I've taken this camera to several concerts, which always poses a challenge to Sony cameras - with the H55, under low light conditions, there is more noise and with some of my concert photos, there is a strange purple haze that makes everything and everybody look purple.  I noticed this while taking a photo at a concert, I could see even on the LCD screen that the people on the other side of the arena from us were looking like a purple blob in the background.  It looked the same when I opened the photo on my computer.  My Sony DSC-H20 never did anything like this!There is also generally just more noise and graininess with the H55 in low light.  It also still has the same flaw as the H20 model, which is that it has a hard time capturing any movement, whether it's a moving cat, moving child, moving rock singer, etc.  My little Canon SD1200 camera can capture moving things better than either of these Sonys!When browsing the sample images posted at Amazon, many people here post a lot of landscape pictures, and they are so pretty.  Any digital camera can capture landscape, the real test is whether it can capture people and pets who are not perfectly still all the time.  Sony cameras always seem to fail in this area.On the bright side, it does make a good video camera, the sound quality on both models is excellent.  One good thing about the Sony digital cameras is their video modes DO have great sound quality, probably the best for filming things like concerts. I've seen YT videos from concerts filmed with Canon and Panasonoc models, and the sound is not as good - Panasonics sound more muted, and with many Canons, the reverb and static is awful!BUT BEWARE: On the H55 model, if using the zoom lens while filming, the sound will go down (not totally mute, but just lower) while zooming in and out.  This is very noticeable when filming at a concert for example.  I filmed a really good song at the Bon Jovi show while using the H55 for the first time & didn't realize until after I got home & saw all my videos what the sound was doing.  It's pretty noticeable, and really annoying.  Luckily for me, I had used my old H20 for most of my video clips, so all was well.So it looks like my search for a good all around P&S; with a bigger zoom lens will have to continue.  Meanwhile I'll still use my Canon SD1200 for everyday snapshots, and my Sony H20 for video clips.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but still is not best for this price
Reviews.Author: Otabek
Reviews.Content: A month ago I got this camera. It is good constructed, handy and easy to use. It comes with ion battery, it's available to make 250 shots+20 min HD video. I go to trips very often, therefore I bought additional battery. The best thing there is panoramic mode. But it is very noisy while shooting video, and it has no DIGITAL ZOOM. And battery clips which attached under the camera is REALLY WEAK, so be careful, can be broken easily. NIGHT MODE is awful, I am not fun of night modes, but it could be better. I had canon sx110 and sx130 before. sx130 has better HD video noise avoid and images are better sometimes, but it is has very slow shooting. So go for it, if you need compact and handy digital camera with panoramic mode. Overall I recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: Good Work
Reviews.Author: Richard Moya "Gichad"
Reviews.Content: Good job, excellent working group, satisfied with the purchase and delivery time ... not hesitate to recommend and return to work with PCs.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: hpis2cool
Reviews.Content: Just completely satisfied with this product! The Intelligent Auto is amazing and very convenient! You get quite a few manual options (for a non-professional camera) and the zoom is the BEST I've ever seen in any point-and-shoot camera! The casing isn't the best (plastic and I get a little scared the battery lid will break sometimes but this is because you get what you pay for. The camera is VERY CHEAP for what it does. I'm sure it'll work just fine for you if you take care of it. Highly recommended product!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera - till it broke
Reviews.Author: B. Morris
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes incredible shots, on a par with my (older) Digital SLR. The zoom works great and has sold me on the need for a longer zoom even in a pocket camera, and the stabilization worked wonders with my high-action family.In fact there was only one problem with the camera at all, albeit a very impactful one: The dial to switch photo modes broke and would just spin and spin without selecting anything. This can be quite annoying when you can't get the thing off of "video" mode, or it's stuck in "macro" or "low light" and you want to get a shot of your kids playing in the pool.The camera was so good, ironically, that my wife and I used it despite the problem for over a month. Work-around - turn the camera off, set the dial, then turn it back on again and 'sometimes' it would set to the right mode.Recommendation: don't get this camera, but if a fix or a new model that includes a fix, ever comes along, I'll join you in buying one then...

Reviews.Title: Great camera with the right size
Reviews.Author: X. Andrade
Reviews.Content: There's not much I can add to what has been said already, I absolutely love this camera, specially its size, it's small and compact enough that makes it easy to take it anywhere you want in your jeans' pocket and at the same time tough enough that it won't break or get damage if you bump it by accident while in your pocket.The picture resolution is I would say 4 and half out of 5, I'm still a fan of 35mm film I think nothing can't beat that however this camera gets closer to that. The battery lasts a long time, I actually used it for a couple of hours a few weeks ago and today I took it out of my drawer and the camera still had power to keep working and that's what made me write this quick review.Over all I'd give it a 5 out of 5, the only problem I found is the stable shot feature, sometimes doesn't work well especially if you try to take pictures while in a car.

Reviews.Title: I really wanted to like this camera
Reviews.Author: A. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Sadly I am back in the camera market as this camera was stolen with some incredibly precious family videos that for some reason I could not get to transfer to my pictures software (don't think that was a camera issue). I came back here to post a review so that others will think again before they purchase this camera. I had VERY high expectations but the proof is in the pictures and even on the "EASY" mode, they just did not meet my expectations. I'm not a professional photographer so I can't give you technical details but I am a picture buff and have enjoyed some very good cameras over the years. The lighting sensor seemed off (either overexposure with the flash or not enough light and was dark)and what bugged me the most was the distortion of the subject. It literally would change the shape of people's heads/bodies. Every now and then I would get a good picture but I just could not count on consistently getting good pictures. Trying to take pictures that involved motion almost never worked out. I did have the best luck with outdoor pictures with natural lighting. Another issue was the location of the flash. You had to constantly make sure your finger did not block it. I do have some good pictures but I won't be purchasing this camera again as I gave it a year of use and I was overall very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot with a very nice feature set
Reviews.Author: rayneu "photoray"
Reviews.Content: It's a decent camera - full disclosure: I am very picky and have sent back several other point and shoot cameras before keeping this one.  The image quality on the lcd is very good; the actual image on the computer is less stellar but for around $150, I can't really complain.  I am used to DSLR cameras and nothing compares to the image quality of a bigger sensor with better lenses.  The Sony H55 takes very good snapshots and the exposures are accurate.  I take very few flash photos and don't like to take images in dark environments since the flash usually destroys the scene so I can't comment on how the flash works.  I enjoy using the panorama stitching mode for an extreme wide angle look - it has very quick rendering and is simple to use.  Sony phone support told me that "some SD cards cannot be used with this camera" when I called and reported an error reading two brand new 8 gb Sandisk SD cards I bought specifically for it.  Had to back down to a 4gb card... I guess they really want you to use their proprietary memory sticks... The HD video is clean although the multi-cable usb cord interface is way too bulky to pack with the camera unless you get a huge bag; the sound is what can be expected with a small microphone on the side of the camera.  I use this camera for snapshots and ebay seller images.  Overall, Sony has done a good job with this camera and I recommend it to anyone who needs a simple camera for outdoor shots and indoor no flash images.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera but-----
Reviews.Author: lynn21
Reviews.Content: I really love the ease of this camera.  I just traveled to Spain, Prague, Austria and Germany. Now I would like to download my pictures to my laptop.  How do I do this?  I only have the yellow, red, white, cable that came when I ordered this from Amazon.  Help!!! What do I need to buy in order to hook up this camera to my laptop???

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Daniela
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that I bought this camera because it takes great pictures and the relation between quality and price is really good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: kas
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best product I have ever purchased. Also I was surprised after seeing that it is a product of Japan.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, very little to complain about
Reviews.Author: MGLC
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty awesome.The quality of pictures is Superior to anything in this price range.We did however have to send it back because the shutter would not open and shut all the way without help. This bothered me and I sent it back.Other than that, camera is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP
Reviews.Author: Pawan "Bh pawankishore Reddy"
Reviews.Content: I am fond of taking pictures. Not a big time photographer but when ever go for an outing then its always obvious that i will be incharge of camera. I bought this camera for a good deal and its the best one that i got for such a price. Its look is awesome. The pictures that it takes is so clear and perfect. I just love this camera. Nothing that i can complain about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Marcos P. da COSTA
Reviews.Content: This camera has an excellent Optical 10X zoom, images are crisp, clear and the colors are brilliant. Video looks great when played in my laptop. Nice panoramic photos. I recommed this camera to anyone who is looking for shooting great quality indoor/outdoor pictures.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality...impressed with very first few pictures
Reviews.Author: Rajendra Prasad
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research for buying a decent camera and decided to buy H55. It had great reviews and it has lived up to its expectations. I was a little skeptical using it the first time but was pleasantly surprised to see such a fine quality of pictures. I read about one issue in other reviews and I agree with it...the pictures doesn't look as good on the computer as they are on the camera LCD screen. I don't understand why...may be there is a mismatch between the pixels of camera LCD and computer LCD. I guess I'll need to try reducing the pixels on camera and then compare the quality..overall I'm satisfied by this camera...worth my money...

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Joannie
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, the sharpness of the pictures is unbelievable, and the zoom is great. It takes great video's and it adjusts the camera to the picture your taking. This is a must have!!

Reviews.Title: Very Poor Performance for still photos
Reviews.Author: seeker7 "seeker7"
Reviews.Content: This review is filled with superlatives, but it is for a reason.  This is probably the most disappointing electronics/technology purchase I have ever made, and that includes my experience with Windows Vista!  This camera is not much better than the camera in my Blackberry.  No joke.  This was purchased to replace a Sony DSC W35.  The old technology was head and shoulders above this camers.  This camera has lots of features, some of them are very nice, but the picture quality is abyssmal.  The panorama function is nice, but the results are very grainy and useless for enlargement or printing.  Low light performance is SHOCKINGLY poor.  The noise in low light is terrible.  There is a focus issue as well, particularly in low light.  The lens is excellent, but the sensor stinks.  Program modes are not reliable.  Color saturation is unpredicable.  Flash is near useless.  LCD is useless in outside light.  There is no viewfinder.  This camera is incredibly underwhelming.  If you want to see a comparison of the quality of this camera and the old 7 MP DSC W35, go to my smugmug account at [...].  Look at the album called Lonely Ride.  The last 3/4 of the pictures in that album were taken with this camera.  You will see very poor quality, and even these are the best of the best this camera can take.  Over 50% of the photos on that trip  were discarded because of poor quality.  Next, look at any album entitled El Paseo Mexicano (there are 5 or 6 of them).  Compare the quality.  El Paseo Mexicano was taken with the cheap, 7 mp camera.  It is light years better than this piece of junk.  Do not buy a DSC H55 unless you can live with cell phone camera quality pictures.  Do not be mislead by the 14 MP label.  This camera is junk quality.  If you are budget constrained, you will do much better with a DSC W150, for the same money.  You won't have panorame, you wont have as good of a lens, but you will get focused, sharp, predictable pictures.  With this piece of junk, getting a good photo is only a 10% probability.  With the DSC W150, the odds increase to about 80% or more.  Sony should be ashamed to release a product that this inferior.  I really wonder how they can sell this thing with a clean conscience.

Reviews.Title: Shoddy quality
Reviews.Author: M. D Wilson
Reviews.Content: In the two years I have owned this camera, I have had to send it into Sony service twice. Once was for the zoom button that broke due to some internal spring breaking, and another time was for when the lens stopped opening.Another problem with this camera is that the wheel to select your camera mode is placed right next to shooting-button and doesn't lock into a mode very snugly. So I would frequently unintentionally change shooting modes while taking pictures.The battery cover does not snap shut securely, and has a habit of swinging open at bad times.The camera takes good pictures, and the zoom when it works, works well. But I have never had so many problems with a Camera. This was my first, and likely last, Sony Camera.

Reviews.Title: Nifty features, major malfunctions
Reviews.Author: jtvt "Justin"
Reviews.Content: This would have been a 4 star item if it lasted longer than 2 weeks. First the good - Big zoom, big MP number, and fits in the side pocket of Carhartts pants, covered what I was looking for. Included in the deal at no extra charge I got the very cool sweep Panorama feature and honest HD video!This panorama mode really is groundbreaking (at least up here since I've yet to see it anywhere else) and if patent law allows I'd be surprised if it doesn't become industry standard. Unfortunately it captures the full (3 image?) pan frame in half the memory space of one regular photo, so pan photos were a little grainy when viewed under zoom.Video quality was superb, best ever on a pocket camera for this reviewer. Even in low light concert situations it surpassed expectations. Speaking of concerts though, zooming while recording did cause very noticeable background noise and an accompanying drop in audio quality.Picture quality was standard for a mid-range point and shoot. Not amazingly sharp and a slight difficulty capturing off the cuff motion shots, but definitely more than acceptable for most uses.And the bad - Two weeks into ownership I went to turn it on. Still on the original battery charge, no drops, dust or water, no likely cause for any damage whatsoever. Screen says, "Turn power off and turn on again", or something like. I do, many times, to the same result. Tried charging the battery, no difference. Took it back to the big W and got the impression from the clerk this wasn't the first return they had seen.Big, big red flag there. The fact that it worked for two weeks before just conking out makes me wonder what's to stop any of these from dying for no reason 3 months in, or 13 months in, out of warranty? Second Sony I've had but I took my money and ran to a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Very poor
Reviews.Author: MatisseFabric
Reviews.Content: I've had cameras from four manufacturers - this is easily the worst.Time for another camera, even though this one is very new.It's a long list of problems. Here we go:1) Start-up and shut-down times are very slow. If you shut down thecamera, and then change your mind, it will take 5 seconds or more.The switch between ON and OFF takes long enough so that it's hardto keep straight whether you are successfully turning off (on)the camera or not.2) Low light is disastrously bad in this camera. Don't do it. Very brightdaylight or don't take the shot.3) The zoom is often extremely slow - it just can't decide that itshould go for it, after you have asked for a zoom. Many secondswasted, waiting for the software to get a clue.4) Focus is incredibly slow, hunting back and forth. Often it doesn'tfind focus in the end. Lots of blurry photos.5) The mode dial gets spun around very easily. You must constantlycheck to make sure that you're in the mode you want to be in.6) Flash washes out everything. Badly mis-calibrated.On the plus side, this camera has a very nice lens. But it is totallywiped out by the terrible digital / software side of the camera.Don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Very sluggish and bad in low light
Reviews.Author: Saurabh Upadhyay
Reviews.Content: Seems like a good camera at first, but after some use I started to find its weaknesses. So called smart zoom is annoyingly slow. Shutter speed is also very slow. Takes good quality pictures in the daylight or well lit area, but completely useless in the night. If you don't use flash in the dark its grainy and if you use flash its overly bright on face. Overall I would say bad camera for its class and price.

Reviews.Title: Very poor photo quality
Reviews.Author: C. W. Price
Reviews.Content: I'm a point-and-shoot traveller who wanted a small camera for travels to Asia. My old Nikon Coolpix 7600 had some sticky buttons, so I thought I'd upgrade to this Sony. The photo quality from this camera is so poor compared side by side to my Nikon; even from photos printed 6 years ago. The only thing I like on this camera is the panorama mode. I don't know enough about cameras to explain why this Sony takes such horrible photos on Auto or Easy mode, but if you're a novice shooter like me, don't get this camera. I'll be buying another (and cheaper) coolpix next time.

Reviews.Title: My 3rd Cybershot
Reviews.Author: Arun Singh
Reviews.Content: I love the zoom and ability to take Panoramic pictures. The two big reasons why I purchased this camera and I am very happy with that. I used this camera for my recent Australia trip. I found small fraction of the pictures to be out of focus and the time to record the picture to be a wee bit long. The longer time to record could be due to the bigger image size. I am not too sure yet about some pictures not being very sharp (5 out of 80). I have to look into that a little more and I will update later on that issue. I like the compactness of the camera. There is a photo transfer application which comes on the camera as an exe file. Before one is able to transfer the image to their pc they have to run this application. In my opinion that application added extra steps and was not much use to me.Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle Optical Zoom with SteadyShot Image Stabilization and 3.0 inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Stunning pictures, excellent videos
Reviews.Author: Justin R. Hodge
Reviews.Content: When I started looking for a new camera I one with a powerful zoom and sharp images, but I also wanted to find one that takes great videos as well (I was tired of having to carry around both a camera and camcorder).  With this in mind, there were a few minor features, like the ability to zoom while taking a video, that I looked for in each camera I considered.  I finally decided to buy this model (about 7 months ago), and I have to say it is the best camera I have ever owned.  The pictures almost always come out crystal clear, and the videos are smooth and with excellent audio quality.  It met and surpassed all my expectations.  The Intelligent Audo mode is great for everyday use, and the image stabilization works very well.  One feature I particularly like is that when you take a picture in some low-light settings the camera snaps two pictures, each sith different settings, and lets you choose which one is the best.  I also like the panorama mode.  I have not used the Program and Manual modes, but they appear to offer plenty of customization options to more professional photographers.  I only have two minor complaints about the camera:1.  The microphone is on the top of the camera, so it's easy to accidentally cover it with your finger when shooting a video.2.  When using the panorama mode, if your picture does not use up the entire panorama view the rest of it is left gray.  I'm not sure why the camera doesn't automatically trim off the extra space.Overall, I would definitely recommend this product to any potential buyer, whether they're a simple point-and-shoot user or a more experienced user who wants plenty of flexibility to tweak a variety of settings.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: xnana21x
Reviews.Content: I've owned 2 Sony Camera's before this one. I love the picture quality of sony, but always had problems with a little bit of blur. I have 2 young kids and they are always running, so to try and get a picture, there would always be blur. I decided to try out this camera and LOVE IT. The I Auto is fabulous! I haven't had any blurring photos. the pictures are AMAZING and colors are AMAZING. i Love it. I don't have anything negative to say. the price and the quality are perfect. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Upset with dial on top of camera - Easily Broken!!!
Reviews.Author: kmurph
Reviews.Content: This was a great little camera.  However, the dial on the top of the camera no longer works.  Ultimately making the camera inoperable.  Very disappointed as we did love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Catherine Jones
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely not a photographer, but I think this is a really good camera. I did a lot of research on point and shoot cameras and this one was the best for the money.

Reviews.Title: Husband loves his new camera!
Reviews.Author: Bargain shopper
Reviews.Content: Best gift Santa tossed in my hubby's stocking! Pro photographer nephew recommended this as the best camera for the money and he was right. Great pic quality, easy to use in a variety of shots and inexpensive compared to others with this many pixels.

Reviews.Title: H55 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: mohan vashisth
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd H55 Camera.I love this little & light piece.I rate myself a little more than a beginner. Previously I have CanonA620.That Camera is also good but that needs AA bateries & I hate that.I like H55 being a chargble batery.Technical photo features of this camera is worth of its price being a 10X zoom, panorama & other features.I have yet to completely explore it but my experiance by now is good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: DaDDEEoOH
Reviews.Content: Excellent price for such a great all around camera, if your not looking into a SLR this is a super camera, everything is adjustable in one setting for a more advanced user or just shoot away and not worry about anything.  Video recording is top notch great quality, suggest at least a 8gb memory stick duo HGpro which will get you about 110 minutes of HD video

Reviews.Title: Heat camera
Reviews.Author: Sheri L. Cranmer
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my 24 year old son whe is in the photo industry. He loves it. Good enough for me!

Reviews.Title: Solid build and features for the price
Reviews.Author: Ajax
Reviews.Content: I think this is a good choice for someone who needs a simple, hi-res point and shoot.  I've been getting good results in our dimply lit house with the intelligent auto settings.Remember to order a memory card and a case!

Reviews.Title: Amazing zoom
Reviews.Author: Axolotl82
Reviews.Content: A terrific camera.  It is very compact but has a fabulous optical zoom that captures fine detail in low light from substantial distances.  Settings are as simple or as detailed as the user wants.  Would prefer AA batteries to lithium, but these recharge easily and stay charged for a long time.  This is the first camera I have bought that lacks a direct viewfinder, but the screen is visible even in bright sunlight.  Overall, I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Chanson S. Sim
Reviews.Content: First of all for $225 and free shipping this camera awesome for the price. I'm thinking that i should of went with a lower megapixel camera, to me if it makes any sense to anyone that it might be to detailed that the picture looks fake, might be a good thing. In a low lit room its not the greatest even with the flash, sometimes i find myself covering the flash with my fingers because of the placement of the flash. Great features. The only draw back is that the camera does not come with Carl Zeiss lenses.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: sir
Reviews.Content: pocket size with lots of features or easy mode if you don't want to mess with everything manually. i love it. even better with SD compatibility.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera for the everyday user.
Reviews.Author: Matthew A. Kramer "the reviewer"
Reviews.Content: Sony had come along ways with their camera, I purchased this camera just before going to my daughters graduation. I also upgraded from my older 6mp Sony P&S; camera. I'm not an expert photographer, but this camera suites 99% of my needs. the movies in HD are just great, as wells as the telephoto lens. I would recomend this camera because it just about has everything and still fits in your shirt pocket, which means you are like to have it when you want it most. Unlike a SLR

Reviews.Title: Super Simple
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "MT"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few point-and-shoot camera's I've seen that holds true to its name. Never had a camera that took better pictures, in as many different light conditions as this one.

Reviews.Title: Good features, but still slow
Reviews.Author: SL
Reviews.Content: I've just recently bought this camera before a 3-week vacation trip, and my impressions are based on that trip. Camera has a number of good features, namely an x10 zoom, 3" LCD screen, panoramic picture taking, and what I liked the most - a very impressive image stabilization system. Battery life is decent - 2 or 3 days of rather intensive picture taking.Negatives include a somewhat bigger package (not sure anything smaller can have an x10 zoom), and a very slow interface. Operating zoom is a challenge, as it is obviously micro-controller operated, and sometimes is busy with something else, when you are trying to frame the picture. Turning the camera off is also excruciatingly slow.

Reviews.Title: GReat camera
Reviews.Author: fiddler "imbuzz"
Reviews.Content: The panorama feature is what makes this truly worth having.  14.1 MP not bad either.I am a wide angle fan which is why, for a point and shoot, I have a Leica 3 Lux 4 with a 24mm (35mm equivalent) lens rather that the 35mm equivalent in most other point and shoots. Then comes along this very nice 14 MP camera that does so many things simply and well and does panoramas too. I am amazed at how easy it is to get a panorama of scenery. landscapes, building interiors and exteriors. The resolution is not huge on panorama but I suspect that there will be others following suit, even into the DSLR field. The latter is of course a reason to wait but then everyone needs a simple portable pocket point and shoot and this is now mine.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: wxmr2212
Reviews.Content: Great Product. Best purchase ever. It's exactly what I was looking for. I totally recommend this item.  HIGH QUALITY AND GOOD PRICE!!!

Reviews.Title: Does It All
Reviews.Author: Captain Brock "Adventurer"
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, a distinct notch above typical point and shoot cameras. Insane good battery life and file space with 8G card. I really only use auto-mode and it works very well. This model is proven and still up to date two years after purchase. Very impressive hi-def video with surprising audio through the pin-hole mic. We taped Adelle at 140 meters in the dark and the results were amazing. I am an experienced shooter but not a serious photography buff; for me this Sony does everything I could ask for.Minor caveats: Zoom during videos may corrupt audio. No intermediate resolution between VGA and 5M. Video is MP4 only.

Reviews.Title: good camera in this price range
Reviews.Author: Vaibhav Kumar
Reviews.Content: a good camera in this price range .. day pics r great, zoom is good, low light pics not that good...

Reviews.Title: Really bad camera
Reviews.Author: Sujay
Reviews.Content: Only good time I spent with this camera was first 3 months. After that faced many issues with the hardware. First ccd and then motherboard went kaaboom. now service center is asking me money more than the cost of this camera..

Reviews.Title: Aweful Indoors
Reviews.Author: Margi Piotrowski
Reviews.Content: We bought this Sony a few weeks before Christmas and discovered that the indoor shots are almost always dark and blurry.  Ruined our holiday and son's 10th birthday party pictures.  Outdoor shots are decent, especially if the subject is perfectly still, color is good- you will always need to use flash indoors.  No good for sports shots.  In camera guide is not much help in the moment, so you are left to read the 60+ page instructions.  Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: dku
Reviews.Content: Loves this camera. It is all it says and more. Very easy to use!! The picture is quality is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: This camera was great for my trip to india.
