The zoom is really good the video quality was good and you can zoom while recording. the paneramic view feature was really useful at some of the locations i was visiting. The images taken by the camera are really clear most of the time.i had the sony w55 before this one its basically a couple of years older but over all same model different body. the only problem i had with that one was the the botton to take pictures eventually popped out so the camera was useless this camera has the same botton and im kind of affrid of that but after heavy use in india nothing happened so i guess im in the clear for now.Pros-14.1MP really clear pictures also very large image files.-HD video (720) with other video setting for less quality.-fairly thin-10x zoom-supports both SD cards and memory stick pro due.-the auto setting is very usefulCons-the botton to take picture feels cheap and it has broken before on the older model.-there are no picture filters available like in the last one model.-takes a bit to warm up-takes a bit to take a picture (not really for sports shooting or fast shots)-motion blurs easily-some pitures come out grainy with low lighting-battery dies really quickly with constent use

Reviews.Title: Great and incredible Digital Camera from Sony.
Reviews.Author: Ivan Gonzalez Landaeta "ivigontu"
Reviews.Content: A little expensive and heavier than W380 with same 14 MP. Its 3" LCD is a plus. So is the panoramic picture taking routine that takes the drudgery out of stitching individual panels. The SDHC memory card slot is more popular than the memory stick duo which often requires an adaptor to read.The DSC-H55s 10x wide (25mm equivalent) lens takes better shots from greater distances and wider landscapes in a compact body. Take breathtaking panoramic shots.I love this camera!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Only complaint is the lack of color options
Reviews.Author: Katelyn M. Tasky
Reviews.Content: I've searched and rifled through the Handbook for this camera and there doesn't appear to be a color menu. The older Sony Cybershot I had had a color menu in the Program function that enabled you to choose Black and White, Sepia, Vivid, and Natural color modes, but this model doesn't appear to have that.Besides that, it's everything I wanted in a new camera. The zoom is great, especially for the price, and the intelligent auto settings, for the most part, work great. There are a few things that have changed in the layout of the menus than my older model, but for the most part it was easy to pick up and use.Best part is that Sony cameras all take the same battery, so for my Europe trip last week I took my old and new batteries, which I switched between, allowing me to charge one while I used the other.All in all, a good buy, just wish they had the color setting they had before.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth G. Nielsen "Kenneth"
Reviews.Content: This camera provides the most important thing to good pictures: A great lens! Past that, have fun with some amazing technology including blink detection, face detection, panorama shooting and stuff of little interest to a serious photographer, but a whole lot of fun for those who simply want to take awesome pictures. I'm more a serious photographer so I wanted some control over settings which this camera provides. You can set, for instance, no flash by default, and have that setting retained when you use the camera again later. The only thing I will be careful not to push on this camera is the ISO speed. Anything over 80 (lowest) ISO speed begins to seriously degrade image quality. To counter that drawback, the lens is fast 2.0 so can give good shots in low light situations.I highly recommend this camera for a person who wants a small point and shoot with excellent 'big camera' capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Mora
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this camera, it has the option of intelligent auto adjustment, which is very usefull to take pictures quickly and for people over 40 like me, who can't see without lenses is suitable. The 3.0 inch LCD is fantastic. This camera takes pictures quicklier than previous Sony cameras I have had.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for this price
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: The camera makes high quality pictures no matter the conditions. You can choose between several options (automatic, inteligent automatic, manual, etc.) depending the experience you have with cameras.This is the best camera with 14 MPix resolution and 10x optical zoom for its price.It has good design and variety of features.

Reviews.Title: Risky- Choose wisely
Reviews.Author: HelloWorld
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from dell because of the deal. I got case, 4GB memory card for $201. I am disappointed because I have been a sony guy for a while and I am not sure I will return. I screen is blurry and the so called "noise cancellation" is very weak. The camera is also very slow. You need to be in high light areas for a decent picture. lets face it how often am I going to be in day-light? I guess this what you get for the price. 14.1 MB is not all that at all.

Reviews.Title: dsch55 best camera for your money
Reviews.Author: elvis
Reviews.Content: i have had cameras before this one but this is so far the best camera i got. i recomend it

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!!
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Kay Stiles "charlie"
Reviews.Content: My husband I purchase the sony 14.1 HD panaramic digital camera in Knoxville, TN 10/15/10 and is exactly what we were in the market for.  Exceptional and awesome features and what a price.  We were in the right store and the right time.  Not only was it marked down but marked down to a awesome price!  I would highly recommend this camera by far!  We have a samsung which I still use at times and will use as a backup camera.  We went from a 6mp to a 14.1 which is what we were looking for also it features HDMI and HD with a 10x zoom and 3" screen so overall I can tell you that it passed the specs with us and has the spectations of this sweet camera!  Also love my little sony case too.  Since we have the sdcards we also went ahead and purchase a 16gb sdcard and so glad we did.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: J. Scarlett
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few weeks ago, and have to say, am very pleased with the outcome as of yet. I am by no means a professional photographer, but the quality of pictures is really great! Prior to the sony, I had been using an Olympus point and shoot and well lets just say, the sony is ten times the quality! The fact that although the viewfinder is a little grainy, the camera takes really clear crisp pictures, depending on the function you are using. So far I have used the easy function, pet mode, and intelligent mode and all are super! I also really like the wide angle feature and digital zoom feature- both are major upgrades from the olympus models I have used in the past. I purchased this camera primarily because I am expecting my first child to be born and after losing my last camera cannot simply rely on my iphone to capture every moment of my daughters birth. Once she gets here, I will have played with the Sony more and can update my review, should anyone care!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: colorado mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my honeymoon and couldn't be happier.  I was looking for a good point and shoot camera that shot well in day and nighttime settings.  This camera does it all...  Would definitely recommend...

Reviews.Title: Decent camera, definitely needs improvement.
Reviews.Author: D. Castaneda
Reviews.Content: Finally, sony cameras can support SD cards, +1 for that. However, I don't think this camera is worth five or four stars. Physically it is a nice camera with good features, but a good camera should take good pictures. I am not at all satisfied with the pictures it takes without flash, they are grainy and blurry. I've played around with different settings like changing the iso setting, but I'm still not satisfied. Also, the flash is too strong and washes out color. Go to a store like best buy and see for yourself. Don't settle for this camera. I heard the HX5V is the better camera with the Exmor R lowlight sensor, and even though it's outside my budget I might try it out. I had a Samsung HZ15W, which I really liked(battery life is pretty bad though), but since someone lost it :(, so I wanted to try something different. If anyone has any suggestions on a better camera for under three hundred dollars, let me know, because I'm still searching.In short I want:-Takes good pictures, both indoors and outdoors and in lowlight conditions-shoots HD video, 720p is good enough(becoming a standard on digital cameras)-min 10 megapixel-would prefer 10x optical zoom, but not a must-good battery for at least 300-350 pictures on a single charge-Size should be small(like the HZ15w or smaller)-should have good features(samsung and canon seem to do well here, never tried a nikon though)-Manual and smart auto settings(something I liked about my samsung)

Reviews.Title: great buy!
Reviews.Author: reveiwer
Reviews.Content: This cam has really awesome features --especially the panaroma sweep! its amazing product! I have ordered it to India all the way from amazon.com after revewing the product throughly. I already possess a sony cybersot older model which is nice & slim. But his h55 model clearly outweighs the kind of features, picture quality and zoom it has! the only good thing would have been if the cam was ultra-slim like the older cybershot models!

Reviews.Title: Will only take still-life photos
Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: This camera is utterly useless if you are trying to take pictures of children, pets or anyone/thing that will not pose absolutely still for a minimum of 5 full seconds. Even using a tripod makes photo taking with this camera almost impossible (I tried). I have to shop the ever-loving 4311 out of every photo just to fix the color balance, as everything is either orange or green. Most of the picture I take of my kids has them motion blurred. Of the photos where my older daughter will sit still, we got good results. We also got good results when my baby would sit still. Unfortunately, that takes about 100 tries just to get 2-3 usable and non-blurry pictures. There is almost no control on settings- I have it set to 800ISO and turned "smile recognition" down to "barely" so that it wouldn't wait until it saw a smile (its idea of "smile" and mine are vastly different it seems)- but that's about it.I did not have this problem with my Cannon which had a "children/pets" setting. This camera has a "pets" setting, but I'm not sure exactly how it's different from any of the other settings other than nighttime, which turns everything green. It also will auto correct to "twilight" in any lighting other than flood lights (we use two 100watt floor lamps, a 100watt halogen and two 40watt table lamps just to get the camera to take pictures that aren't grainy messes) or direct sunlight. The middle of the day in my living room is apparently "twilight" (unless we use aforesaid lighting) and receives the green treatment. It takes forever to focus, and once your subject moves it goes out of focus to an almost comical degree. The camera likes to wait until it thinks the photo is "optimal", which means that it will not actually take a photo when you press the button (sometimes several seconds later after the baby has crawled off), so you lose baby smiles and sibling hugs/kisses entirely.I tried to use the camera in low-light setting in order to take photos of lights in a dim room (candles with only a table lamp to get the low light), and they didn't even show up. I got a solid black grainy background with a white circle of indistinguishable grainy light and vague outlines.If you like to set up a brightly lit studio with solid same-depth backgrounds and shoot perfectly posed and still subjects- this camera may work for you. Otherwise? Pass.

Reviews.Title: Sony Digital Camera DSC-H55
Reviews.Author: Dennis Kidwell
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I love the features, image stabilization, 3 inch LCD, 14.1 MP, 10x wide angle optical zoom and smile dection to name a few.  The most important thig is this camera takes great pictures and is small and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre camera
Reviews.Author: BangForMyBuck
Reviews.Content: Bought this a month ago to replaced a Canon SD750. I've only played around with it here and there sinc. Yesterday, went to a birthday party yesterday and pulled out my new camera to use.  The H55 takes great outdoor pictures and the panoramic mode is awesome, but indoor it SUCKS. There's a noticeable lag (1/2 second almost?!) when taking pictures. In a room that's dimly lit, there are 2 flashes first, then there's probably a half second lag before the picture gets taken. If there's a lightbulb just above you or the subject, the picture comes out too bright. The video is supposed to be in HD 750p, but the clarity of the video captures looks kinda weird. Can't really describe it but it just doesn't look right.I was hoping to return it to Amazon, but I've already past the 30 day Return windows.  I probably should have done more research on this first, but having a Cybershot HD Camcorder HC5 for 3 years that is just absolutely awesome, I thought their camera's would be just as good. WAS I WRONG!

Reviews.Title: This Camera Has Been Good To Me
Reviews.Author: Bryan Laurienti
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in January 2011 (almost exactly a year ago), and over the course of using it, I've become a professional photographer. Well, maybe not. But it is the easiest digital camera I've ever owned. I've only had one problem with it, and it was my fault. Shortly after I bought it, a co-worker used it to photograph some stuff in the office, proceeded to plug it into their USB port, but it didn't work. Apparently, it wasn't a USB port and the result was that it utterly destroyed my camera's ability to connect via USB. All was not lost, however, because I can still use the memory/SD card to retrieve my photos and videos.As for features, it has plenty. I particularly enjoy the panoramic setting as well as the smile detection. The videos are always perfect, and that helps if you enjoy enjoy sharing them with others and you've had the experience of friends scoffing at your shaky videos, which they probably didn't want to watch in the first place! I'm not a photography expert at all, but I do believe in one of the settings it takes multiple CR2 images (very high quality) that you can somehow assemble on your computer to create HDR images, which are those vibrant, unreal looking photos. I recently upgraded to an 8GB SD/memory card because I use it too much!Anyway, I love this product and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a simple, straight forward camera.

Reviews.Title: Junk DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Curtis T Bowers
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for about 2 years and it broke already. We only used it about 8 times for birthday parties and special events. It started out taking great pictures, but now the image sensor is out of whack. Everything is over exposed in normal lighting conditions and with or without flash. If a picture is taken in a dark room, with very limited light you can see a picture and there appears to be rings around the picture starting in the middle and going out. Sony wants $90 to just check it for repair. Never buying Sony again.

Reviews.Title: I have never hated a camera before
Reviews.Author: Laura Treider
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera without reading any reviews when the Canon that I loved suddenly broke after 4 years right before my son's Halloween party.I hate this camera. The pictures it takes are nowhere near as nice as I'm used to, and the lens cover keeps getting stuck partly open or partly closed. It's not worth what they're asking for it. I might pay $100 for this camera, that's it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect except the charger ( from other model)
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo V. Vejar
Reviews.Content: Todo perfecto. La camara es muy buena y cómoda. El único error es que enviaron un cargador de batería que no sirve ya que es de otro modelo!!!!!El vendedor no hizo un check list del producto.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: A friend say to me. Why you buy a Sony Camera the Cannon are better! in this moment a take a picture in sweet panorama and finally he saw d=the difference between Sony  and Canon.The quality when you use the zoom is magnificent, honestly I LOVE THIS CAMERA and the seller by on time.

Reviews.Title: More Goods than Bad - Good Value
Reviews.Author: Yogi
Reviews.Content: It has been 2 months since I owned this camera. I am impressed with the feature set that comes with the camera, especially the 3" LCD screen, 10x wide angle zoom, Panorama/HD video features and the semi-manual controls.It's easier to quote just the drawbacks: Size is a little big (that's because of 10x zoom), Slow interface response, Battery life is okay but not great, Low light pictures are just fair and could be better.I give it a 4 star rating considering the few cons listed above. It is definitely a good value for the money and recommended.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera - Value for money
Reviews.Author: Tarun
Reviews.Content: I own this camera for a while now, and I must say that I don't have to repent on my decision.Its great value for money. It takes great pictures in well lit conditions, for little darker places, it is average. It gives me fair bit of manual controls, which is impressive.

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camara

Reviews.Content: Son 2 camaras Sony H55 las que he comprado, muy bonitas y muy facil de manejar, el zoom es muy bueno y la definicion excelente, recomiendo este modelo

Reviews.Title: It is just I need
Reviews.Author: Sofi
Reviews.Content: This is really amazing product from Sony, picture quality is amazing and even the videos are of HD quality

Reviews.Title: Good compact camera with 10x zoom that works!
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Lindsey "G"
Reviews.Content: Always have used Sony compact cameras, and this is the best one yet.  Especially for the price, the camera has numerous features which I won't repeat here, but they all seem to work as advertised.  Good camera.

Reviews.Title: Had to change my mind about this one
Reviews.Author: slim "57psalm"
Reviews.Content: I went from thinking this thing was a piece of trash, to actually buying one.I have no regrets!I was looking for a new compact digital for travel, preferably with a wide lens as well as good zoom. I never trust what they claim for a zoom factor anymore.The first thing I do when I am trying out a camera is turn off the digital zoom. It's worthless. It can't take the place of resolution. Any photo editing program can give you "digital" zoom after you've taken the picture.To determine how the zoom really looks, I put the camera up in one hand, zoom it in on something far away as far as it will go, and compare the image frame with what my eye sees.  On full zoom, this camera manages to get images slightly bigger than what my eye sees. Zooming out, it can make things look almost microscopic.Pros:---------------------------------------------------CMOS does better in low-light settings, hands down. 'Nuf said.Very compact size for such a large zoom factor.Small enough for travel.Zeiss lenses - the best IMHO.Built-in lens cover that automatically closes and opens for you. No more dangling lens cap!Panoramic feature is really pretty good, provided there isn't a lot of movement (on your part or the camera frame) when you take the picture. The picture doesn't look hardly distorted or "fish-eyed" either.Sony didn't change much on the controls. I'm glad for that as I hate having to learn a new system on every camera I own.-----------------------------------------------------------------Cons;14 megapixels. Why, you ask, do I say this is a con?  Average 35mm film is about the equivalent of 8 megapixels.  Having super-high resolution only takes up more memory without really giving you a noticeably better picture, especially if you are printing out 5 x 7's or smaller. I wish I could have found a 10 megapixel camera with twice as much zoom.I cannot get a good focus in macro mode using the "intelligent auto mode." It makes no sense to me. My other digital cameras do not have this issue.  I can put them in "macro" mode, and zoom in so that the object fills the frame, and it will auto focus.  This camera won't do that. Instead, when I zoom in on the item, it gets blurry and won't focus no matter how close or far away the object is. So I back it out to wide angle mode, hold the object closer, and then the camera focuses and I get the picture I wanted. What is the point of macro mode when it won't focus on objects within 2 feet?------------------------------------------------------------------Overall: I'm glad I bought it, even if the zoom is disappointing. The panoramic feature has worked out well for me so far.It will be great when traveling because it is really compact.Now if I could find a camera that acts like an SLR, but is the size of a pocket camera, with at least 10 megapix, I'd buy it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth Getting
Reviews.Author: D. Jones
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Christmas gift.  My brother had one and his took good photos.  I used it straight out of the box on auto.  Every photo I took was horrible.  The photos were over exposed in every situation.  I took indoor photos, I took photos on a field trip for my daughter where the lighting was perfect and still the pictures came out blurry.  I wanted a point and shoot that I did not have to think about. I can't believe what horrible photos this camera took.  I have owned several point and shoot cameras over the years.  This was by far the worst one yet.  Needless to say it was returned.

Reviews.Title: Great camera... NOT!  Watch out!
Reviews.Author: A. Dionne
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I love Sony Cybershots.  I own several. I bought this one for the 10X optical zoom and sports setting.  It was with me last night for my son's baseball game and I am so impressed.  It takes GREAT shots, even better than my other cameras.  Love it.Oct 2010. Well, let's just say my glowing review has now been downgraded.  WATCH OUT.  Customer relations and repair will not do anything with this camera.  My pictures are horribly distorted.  The subject will be long or curved. For instance, I took a picture with my son and his body is HUGE and his head is SMALL.  Another time, my husband and I were taking a picture and the camera distorted my face to be very long and much larger than my husbands even though we are sitting side by side.  I called Sony for repair. I sent my camera in and Sony replaced the optical unit.  They sent it back. I used it again and the same problem occured.  I called and said that I wanted a new camera, same model and they said NO.  My mom purchased the same one at the same time and hers works perfectly, Sony doesn't care.  They said to send it back for repair and they will test it. The test came back and Sony said it worked according to specifications... needless to say, they are sending it back and I am throwing it away.  I have owned Sony forever.  I have radios, tv's, cybershots and camcorders.  I will not be buying Sony again.  Don't do it!  I have spent at least 6 hours over the course of the last week to have this issued resolved and after $250 and 6 months of use, the camera is junk.  Not really worth the money.

Reviews.Title: great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: M. "M."
Reviews.Content: Only thing it does not have is a sound recorder. Takes really great pictures, lots of great features at a low price.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-H55
Reviews.Author: Sachin Khade
Reviews.Content: This is really amazing product from Sony, bought it after lots of R&D;, picture quality is amazing and even the videos  are of HD quality....really amazing camera any fresher can user this camera, just point and shoot....i am loving it...i  bought 2 one for myself and the other for my friend.

Reviews.Author: Estenin Romero
Reviews.Content: Esta camara es buenisima me parece una de las cosas buenas que ha sacado sony por tan bajo precio comparadas con otras marcas el unico defecto que veo en fotografias nocturnas es lo granulado pero escogiendo la escena correctamente me parece muy buena por lo que la califico con 5 estrellas

Reviews.Title: Simple and high quality
Reviews.Author: Philipe Kupferman
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my purchase... it's small and i got high quality pictures with a very good zoom.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera so far
Reviews.Author: John Kessler
Reviews.Content: So far this camera has done pretty good.  The only complaint I have is that if the subject moves at all while taking the pic it seems to always blur.

Reviews.Title: Beware Sony Warranty
Reviews.Author: Frank R. Bellacera "Frank"
Reviews.Content: I don't own this particular camera but you should be aware of my experience with the Sony warranty that came with the camera. After only 3 months, the camera just stopped working while on vacation. I returned the camera to the repair facility in Laredo, TX (at my own expense).  A couple of weeks later I received an email requesting my authorization to go ahead and repair the camera. The cost estimate was: $45 for labor and $593.58 for parts. WHAT!! The cameras original cost was less than $300. So what about my warranty? When I called the repair facility, a very pleasant young man informed me that their experts found a piece (???) of the camera broken which led to the failure of the camera. They summarily determined that the part was broken by my misuse.  I explained that there was nothing visibly "broken" when I returned the camera (there are only 2 movable parts on the outside of the camera) and that it stopped working in the middle of taking normal snap-shots. That's it. So-sorry! End of warranty. End of story.

Reviews.Title: Shoping
Reviews.Author: Ski
Reviews.Content: The sweep panaramic feature is what really interested me.  Took a SDHC card to a store an snaped a bunch of pictures. When I looked at them on the computer and HDTV, decided not to buy at this point.  Really recommend if interested in this camera to take a SD card and take sample pics first.  Sweep feature is cool.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Junaid Bhatti "J.A.B"
Reviews.Content: For the price its an excellent Camera. I am satisfied. SONY hardly ever lets me down.

Reviews.Title: dissappointed
Reviews.Author: A. Thema "h.a lecture"
Reviews.Content: I am sure I got a lemon, the pictures are so grainy it makes me wonder if it is a 14.1 mp. I had high expectation, I am very disappointed...

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed!
Reviews.Author: M. Scian
Reviews.Content: I researched a lot of cameras and stuck with Sony for the 4th time. It is hard to review a camera better than a single star since the camera would continually come up with re-insert memory card. In just a couple weeks of use and a few different memory cards I missed some great pictures of my kids. It looked like a great camera but I cant risk losing photo ops! Back to drawing board. I wish it worked for me.

Reviews.Title: AMAZON ITEMS ARE GOOD AND ECCONOMY
Reviews.Author: Ramu
Reviews.Content: AMAZON ITEMS ARE GOOD AND ECCONOMY as comparitve to all other........amazon maintaining the time to time delivery................

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy this Package: Camera + Memory Card + carrying case
Reviews.Author: J. Warling "zombie fan"
Reviews.Content: "Frequently Bought Together" INDEED!  But not sent together, if at all.I assumed that a company like Sony would include a memory card with their cameras but this one does not.  If a $200 price tag doesn't give them enough profit margin, they should raise the price so that they can include a memory card.  I have 3 words for Sony:  CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP!  I also thought I was buying an "extra" card with this package.  The camera arrived, the carrying case arrived, but the memory card (sent separately from "Digital Media Source") never did.  Amazon instructed me to contact the seller.  When I did, I discovered that others had had the same experience and that Digital Media Source refused to make good the missing memory card which they sent via untrackable USPS.  I'm sure they'll blame the post office.  Buyers have to hastle Amazon to get their money back.Too bad that companies like Sony & Digital Media Source make Amazon make up for their lousy business practices.Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle Optical Zoom with SteadyShot Image Stabilization and 3.0 inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY - this camera only capture images at 72 DPI!! totally worthless
Reviews.Author: Melissa "Melissa"
Reviews.Content: my business requires photos to be at least 300 dpi (photos for magazine articles, newspaper articles, graphic artists building advertising material)I've just been on chat with Sony support and they've confirmed this camera only captures images at 72 dpi. this is absolutely unacceptable and should be on the packaging!I am so disappointed, especially b/c my last camera i loved, which was a sony cybershot, so i went with Sony again.If you utilize your camera professionally, DO NOT BUY
